If the default 10 is too noisy, I would adjust it to a more appropriate number by default, to have a rule "already configured for most cases" when it is enabled. 50 looks like too far away from the default to me.
Could you have a look at the distribution of values on our test projects? Then the boundary could be set to catch 5-10% of them.

Sounds like a good idea. I checked in sonarqube locally. So the majority of issues contain <20 assertions. If we want to be even less noisy I'll suggest to put 25.
Wdyt, 20 or 25?
shouldn't you also remove the ASSERTION_INVOCATION_MATCHERS and REACTIVE_X_TEST_METHODS constants from this file, since you duplicated it in UnitTestUtils?

you already have the declaration in the visitMethod() method (L70), why not directly use it instead of the symbol?
So you would not have to jump into the declaration. You can these the symbol inside this method the.
I don't see the interest of using a BaseTreeVisitor if you are only visiting methods. Use an IssuableSubscriptionVisitor, it will be simpler.

2 comments:


With an IssuableSubscriptionVisitor, you could directly call reportIssue(methodTree.simpleName())


I think it would be valuable to use secondaries on all the assertions, in order to proof our count.
the field name sounds complicated for a so simple purpose. Why not calling it maximum or threshold only?
